column4: hi all, i need help guys. I m facing problms with ubuntu 8.10. I have installed it on the first prtition of my hdd and also inside windows but the problm is that it does not boot up in any of the installations after logging in.
logging in where?
loggin in ubuntu, i have created account while installation
then, what does not 'boot up' ?
dude after putting up my uid and passwd in there. It just shows a black screen and doesnt proceed..
did you try a shell?
just press CTRL + ALT + F1 and see if you can login in a shell
i mean after putting ud and pas when i press ctrl+alt+f1 the shell doesnt comes up
sounds theres some boot-up problems with gnome, not with your video-card.. you get the nice colored login screen right?
try it again, sometimes you might need to press it twice
but without loging in through GUI when i press ctrl+alt+f1 the shell comes up nd i login there
i tried it so many times dude
okay, you might be able to fix it from the shell.. why not try running gnome from the shell, so it might return some errors
u mean the cmd init 3 from shell?
just login in your shell and run gnome
can u give me the cmd to run gnome
then get back to the shell and see if there are errors
sure, hold on
i believe its gnome-session
but you have to have X running first.. but if GDM has started, i believe X is started as well..
shall i do restart /etc/init.d/?dm??
that shouldnt be the problem, but if you feels that can work it doesnt hurt
ok going to reboot now to do that
